intro: Randia acuminatissima, commonly known as the sharp-pointed randia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It is a shrub or small tree that typically grows to a height of 1–3 meters. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are usually white or pale yellow, followed by red, fleshy fruits. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Randia acuminatissima is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
